articles.title: A Report on How the Web is Really Using JavaScript
articles.description: Each year, the HTTP Archive puts together the Web Almanac, a report on the ‚Äòstate of the Web‚Äô. The JavaScript section has just gone live and goes into depth on how much JS we‚Äôre using (or failing to use!), the popularity of TypeScript, loading methods, Web Worker use, and, yes, jQuery still leads the way!
articles.author: HTTP Archive

articles.title: Lynx: A Fresh Way to Build Apps from Web Technologies
articles.description: Lynx is a new set of tools for building JavaScript-powered native and Web apps that draws inspiration from React Native but aims to be more modular and flexible (and eventually framework agnostic). It comes from, and is used by, TikTok, and comes with its own QuickJS-based JavaScript engine.
articles.author: Xuan Huang and the Lynx Team

articles.title: Announcing TypeScript 5.8
articles.description: Four months in the making, TypeScript 5.8 lands with a strong Node focus. You can now use require() for ES modules in the nodenext module, there‚Äôs a new node18 module for developers who want to keep targeting Node 18, and most notably there‚Äôs now an --erasableSyntaxOnly option to ensure no TypeScript-only runtime semantics can be used.
articles.author: Microsoft

articles.title: JavaScript Fatigue Strikes Back
articles.description: A developer with ‚Äòa decade away‚Äô from writing JavaScript returns to find that one thing hasn‚Äôt changed: ‚ÄúChoosing the right JavaScript framework is hard, man.‚Äù
articles.author: Allen Pike

articles.title: Dr. Axel's 'Sales Pitch' for TypeScript
articles.description: As one of JavaScript‚Äôs most esteemed writers, if Dr. Axel can‚Äôt convince you of the value of TypeScript, who could?
articles.author: Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

articles.title: Reimplementing Crossy Road in JavaScript
articles.description: Two well put together tutorials so far covering reimplementing Crossy Road with either Three.js or React Three Fiber. In both written or video form.
articles.author: Hunor M√°rton Borb√©ly

articles.title: Node Just Added TypeScript Support. What Does That Mean for¬†Deno?
articles.description: The Deno team, who went all in on TypeScript from day one, reflects on the continued increase in levels of support for TypeScript in Node and how their approaches differ.
articles.author: Andy Jiang and Ryan Dahl

articles.title: TanStack Form v1.0: Headless, Type-Safe Form State Management
articles.description: A type-safe, framework agnostic (React, Vue, Angular, Solid and Lit are all supported out of the box), headless and isomorphic way to create and work with forms, with this v1.0 release over two years in the making. If you already use things like Formik or React Hook Form and are wondering how it differs, here‚Äôs a comparison table.
articles.author: Tanner Linsley

articles.title: PDFSlick 2.2: View and Interact with PDF Documents
articles.description: A full-featured PDF viewer for React, Solid, Svelte and other JS apps. Built on top of PDF.js, it uses Zustand to provide a reactive store for documents. Demo.
articles.author: Vancho Stojkov

articles.title: Electron App Boilerplate with Modern Dependencies
articles.description: A basic template app that uses React 19, Tailwind CSS 4, shadcn/ui, Electron Vite, Biome, and includes a GitHub Actions release workflow.
articles.author: Dalton Menezes

articles.title: Fable: A F# to JavaScript Compiler
articles.description: If you fancy F#‚Äôs flavor of almost-entirely-functional development, this could be for you. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Fable

articles.title: React Data Table: Responsive Dynamic Table Component
articles.description: Simple and clean, but flexible. Includes features like column sorting and pagination out of the box. Lots of demos and code examples. GitHub repo.
articles.author: John Betancur

articles.description: The Svelte team shares its latest monthly update of what's new.
Straightforward examples of basic design patterns implemented in pure JavaScript.
ü§ñ The folks behind the State of JS survey are running State of Web Dev AI, a new survey focused on the use of AI in modern Web development.
Electron 35.0 ‚Äì You can now attach a preload script to Service Workers. Dependencies are also bumped to Chromium 134 and Node 22.14.
Angular 19.2 ‚Äì We mentioned this last week but there's now an official post with more details.
React Aria March Release ‚Äì Adobe's fantastic suite of React components.
zx 8.4 ‚Äì Google's tool for better Node shell scripting.
eslint-plugin-vue v10.0.0, Readability.js 0.6, NodeBB 4.1

articles.title: Functions in CSS?
articles.description: We can‚Äôt use custom CSS functions in production just yet, but this early look at how they‚Äôre currently being prototyped in Chrome Canary offers a glimpse at the future capabilities (arguments, type-checking, etc).
articles.author: Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez

articles.title: Views on 'Views'
articles.description: Discussions are underway to potentially change the definition of a ‚Äòweb page‚Äô to best accommodate the various contexts in which we can now interact with web content (such as in native apps or VR). One such suggestion is to use ‚Äòview‚Äô.
articles.author: Hidde de Vries

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Everything You Need to Know About Invoker Commands
articles.description: command and commandfor attributes are a brand new HTML web platform feature coming later in 2025. Here‚Äôs everything you need to know about them, plus some things you really don‚Äôt.
articles.author: Keith Cirkel

articles.title: Truth, Lies and Progress Bars
articles.description: Yeah, sometimes loading/progress indicators lie because demonstrating some amount of forward momentum gives users oft-needed confidence that things are continuing as intended. There‚Äôs a few things we can do to enhance that experience ‚Äî as Tyler touches on here.
articles.author: Tyler Sticka

articles.title: Trusting AI with My Images Wasn't Easy
articles.description: We shared last week how Dries was experimenting with various LLMs for writing alt-text for thousands of images. Here he reflects on the effort, concluding that ‚Äúsometimes, the best way to improve is to step aside and let a tool do the job better‚Äù
articles.author: Dries Buytaert

articles.title: CSS Meets Voxel Art: Building a Rendering Engine with Stacked Grids
articles.description: Another great tutorial from Codrops, this time showing how transforms, perspective, and stacked grids can create a fully addressable 3D space, pushing the boundaries of just what‚Äôs possible with pure CSS. You can create your own voxel creations here.
articles.author: Agustin Capeletto

articles.title: ‚≠êÔ∏è¬†Building a CSS-Only Star Rating Component
articles.description: A tutorial you‚Äôve no doubt seen countless times, but typically relying on a little bit of JavaScript. Temani shares a strictly CSS-only approach.
articles.author: Temani Afif

articles.title: Fixing rowspan=0 on Tables on WebKit
articles.description: Curious as to how a browser bug gets fixed? This post is a detailed walkthrough of that process.
articles.author: Karl Dubost

articles.title: A Chrome on Android Edge-to-Edge Migration Guide
articles.description: Bramus shares an update regarding edge-to-edge display support in Android, and how to migrate your site to support this feature ‚Äì especially if you‚Äôre using position: fixed content at bottom: 0.
articles.author: Bramus Van Damme (Google)

articles.title: Building Websites with 'LLMs'
articles.description: That‚Äôs (L)ots of (L)ittle ht(M)l page(S) by the way. üòú Jim shares an approach for building pages with less reliance on JavaScript-injected content.
articles.author: Jim Nielsen

articles.title: The Case for Minimal WordPress Setups: A Contrarian View on Theme Frameworks
articles.description: Kevin thinks modern frameworks ‚Äúcause far more problems than they solve‚Äù ‚Äî as such, he asks why they‚Äôre so popular, and whether they really benefit developers in the long run?
articles.author: Kevin Leary

articles.title: Astro 5.4: A Picture-Perfect Release
articles.description: The popular content site framework introduces several key improvements, including remote image optimization in Markdown, experimental responsive image support in Markdown, new configuration helpers and more.
articles.author: Matt Kane

articles.title: Kibo UI: A Registry of Accessible Components Designed to Use with shadcn/ui
articles.description: A modest set of about 20+ components that use the shadcn/ui CSS variables and they work well as building blocks for more complex components.
articles.author: Hayden Bleasel

articles.title: Stylelint: A 'Mighty' Modern Style Linter
articles.description: An established linter with over 100 built-in rules to help ‚Äúcatch errors, apply limits and enforce stylistic conventions‚Äù. GitHub repo.
articles.author: stylelint

articles.title: Freesound: A Collaborative Collection of 670,000+ Free Sounds
articles.description: Downloadable in WAV format, possibly useful for adding UI sounds to an app, or for adding to videos. Take note of the license for any sound, as not all are CC.
articles.author: Universitat Pompeu Fabra

articles.title: Pierre: A Striking New Web Site with a Git Platform Attached
articles.description: Pierre bills itself as a ‚Äònew Git platform‚Äô but everyone on social media this week was more wowed by its far out Web design rather than what it‚Äôs selling. It evokes early 00s Web experiences with a blend of modern Web technology and retro glitchy aesthetic. One to be seen.
articles.author: Pierre Computer Company
